column2: Watch: Elon Musk declares he is first SNL host with Aspergerâ€™s Syndrome
column5: Elon Musk hosted Saturday Night Live last night. The opening monologue lasted more than five minutes and even his most vocal critics will have to admit that Musk did a pretty good job. He was funny â€“ poking fun at himself and in a nod to Motherâ€™s Day he included his own mom by bringing her on stage with him. The best line from Elon Muskâ€™s opening monologue was â€œI reinvented electric cars and Iâ€™m sending people to Mars in a rocket ship. Did you think I was also going to be a chill normal dude?â€  No no one expects Elon Musk to be a â€œchill normal dude.â€ He boldly pursues some big goals and often creates some interesting headlines along the way. Musk marches to the beat of his own drum and has been rewarded handsomely. And yeah heâ€™s a little weird though when a person is so wealthy the description is usually â€˜eccentricâ€™. Take a look at the monologue if you havenâ€™t seen it yet and then weâ€™ll continue. Monologue! ğŸ’« @elonmusk pic.twitter.com/xeH1EOU79A â€” Saturday Night Live â€“ SNL (@nbcsnl) May 9 2021  Itâ€™s good right? The statement that heâ€™s the first host with Aspergerâ€™s Syndrome is not quite accurate as it turns out. Dan Akroyd has hosted the show and many fans on social media were quick to point out that Akroyd was diagnosed with Aspergerâ€™s in the 1980s. Musk did hedge his claim by quickly saying â€œOr at least the first to admit it.â€  Actor comedian and writer Dan Aykroyd who also suffers from Asperger Syndrome hosted the show back on May 17 2003 which was the 28th Season Finale. Dan once revealed â€œMy very mild Aspergerâ€™s has helped me creatively. I sometimes hear a voice and think: â€˜That could be a character I could do.'â€ Dan was diagnosed with Asperger Syndrome in the 1980s after his wife Donna encouraged him to see a doctor. He views some of his strengths as stemming from the condition. â€œOne of my symptoms included my obsession with ghosts and law enforcement â€” I carry around a police badge with me for example. I became obsessed by Hans Holzer the greatest ghost hunter ever. Thatâ€™s when the idea of my film Ghostbusters was born.â€ When the choice of Musk to host the show was made public there was some blowback which frankly never made sense to me. The media blew up the story that some of the SNL cast were upset and that they were refusing to work with him. Why? What has Elon Musk done that would warrant that kind of nonsense? As it turns out it was a lot of media hype and little else. A few Bernie bros voiced their disapproval of Musk apparently based on his financial success and past tweets.  Bowen Yang responded to one of Muskâ€™s tweets about his upcoming appearance. On Saturday Musk had tweeted saying â€œLetâ€™s find out just how live Saturday Night Live really is.â€ Yang reacted at first with a frowning face. Then he posted Muskâ€™s tweet with a message above: â€œWhat the fâ€” does that even mean?â€ Andrew Dismukes another cast member also gave his take in an Instagram story. Over a photo of SNL alumna Cheri Oteri which looked like a magazine cover Dismukes wrote â€œONLY CEO I WANT TO DO A SKETCH WITH IS Cher-E Oteri.â€ A third cast member Aidy Bryant subtly criticized Musk too. In an Instagram story Bryant shared a tweet from former presidential candidate and Senator Bernie Sanders. In it Sanders criticized the sharp wealth inequality in the country noting that â€œthe 50 wealthiest people in this country own more wealth than some 165 million Americansâ€ and he called that â€œa moral obscenity.â€ Sudi Green a writer for SNL shared the same Sandersâ€™ post too. Most members of the cast were pleased to be working with Musk. There was a cast dinner after a rehearsal and Pete Davidson told a radio show host that he didnâ€™t understand the controversy. Most of the critical tweets from other cast members have been deleted. â€œWe didnâ€™t discuss it at all because weâ€™re all just likeâ€¦ I just donâ€™t understand why this is the dude everyoneâ€™s so freaked out aboutâ€ Davidson said. â€œI was like â€˜What did he do? Heâ€™s just like a really wealthy businessman that makes like nerd sâ€”.â€™ I donâ€™t know. Heâ€™s really nice. Iâ€™m excited.â€ When asked if there was any truth that the cast was upset over Musk as host Davidson said he hadnâ€™t noticed that to be the case. â€œNobody that I fâ€” withâ€ he replied. â€œEverybodyâ€™s kind of been like â€˜Yo whoâ€™s the guy thatâ€™s so pissed off?â€™ Cause weâ€™re on a group text so weâ€™re all just like â€˜I donâ€™t know.â€™ So yeah weâ€™re all excited and really donâ€™t understand the controversy.â€ Musk isnâ€™t the first billionaire to host the show. Donald Trump did so the first time in 2004 but he was already well known in the entertainment industry. There wasnâ€™t criticism over Trumpâ€™s wealth at the time. One article in the Hollywood Reporter notes it is unusual for non-entertainers or musicians to host the show. It may not be common but it happens. Musk was a brilliant choice especially since the show so often gets low ratings these days. He generated a lot of hype for the show.  Prior to the episode airing comedian Sarah Cooper tweeted â€œI hate the fact that elon musk is hosting SNL and I hate even more the fact that thereâ€™s literally no way I wonâ€™t watch it.â€ Meanwhile Conan Oâ€™Brien tweeted â€œBillionaires actually make great SNL hosts. Go back and watch the John D. Rockefeller episode.â€ Thanks to Elon Musk and his flair for innovation SNL was live-streamed internationally on YouTube in over 100 countries for the first time. The best revenge is success and Musk found that in his SNL gig. Let the haters hate. Musk won this round.
